newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan firm in Boeing maintenance deal.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan firm in Boeing maintenance deal.

text.p: Taiwan's Air Asia Company Ltd said on Tuesday that Boeing Co of the United States has authorised the firm to become Boeing's maintenance service centre on the island.

"We recently signed a contract with Boeing and Boeing authorised us to be its maintenance service centre in Taiwan for first its B-234 and then CH-47D helicopters," Chang Shun-lien, an Air Asia director, said by telephone.
"Boeing does not limit our service to a certain area or region," Chang said, adding that the contract would allow Air Asia to service Boeing until 2005.
The company gave no financial details.
In August 1995, Air Asia signed an agreement with U.S. aircraft maker McDonnell Douglas Corp to become McDonnell Douglas's authorised maintenance service centre in Taiwan.
